intro: Bocquillonia sessiliflora, commonly known as the sessile-flower bocquillonia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink to white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid lowland areas. Bocquillonia sessiliflora is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
